heritage_sites.name: Victoria Memorial
heritage_sites.short_description: An iconic marble monument dedicated to the memory of Queen Victoria.
heritage_sites.full_history: The Victoria Memorial is a large marble building on the Maidan in Central Kolkata, built between 1906 and 1921. It is dedicated to the memory of Queen Victoria, then Empress of India, and is now a museum and tourist destination under the auspices of the Ministry of Culture.
heritage_sites.bot_story_script: Hello! The Victoria Memorial is not just a monument, but a symbol of Kolkata's history. Did you know that the angel on top of the dome, known as the 'Angel of Victory', acts as a weather vane? Let me tell you more about its fascinating construction...

cultural_topics.name: Durga Puja
cultural_topics.description: A major Hindu festival originating in the Indian subcontinent which reveres and pays homage to the Hindu goddess, Durga. It is particularly popular in West Bengal, especially in Kolkata.
